pros: The memories of building the heart center and all the late nights providing care to the patients needing our help.
cons: Pretty much everything since the Memorial Hospital of South Bend merger/take over.  It was at this time most of our leadership that helped build up the hospital left.  The ones that stayed were not as talented in leadership as the ones that left.  The vision was all Memorial and the management left at Elkhart were in fear of losing their jobs.  So instead of doing the right thing they would do what was easy and not get themselves noticed.  No longer did being an employee there bring any sort of value and was told repeatedly be lucky you have a job.  When in reality I now realize were scare tactics by scared managers and dept heads.  Now that I have moved to a different town and employer I can now see Elkhart General is a reflection of the town itself.  Someplace that if your not born there you probably made a mistake somewhere along the way to end up there.

review_title: Great Nurses, doctors and technicians in the ER, management is the bad apple
pros: The staff is like family among each other and are didcated to thier profession regardless of how much management depletes morale.
cons: So much emphasis on how things need to improve and how the employees need to "work harder, save cost, be nicer, etc." ; an employee genuinely feels unappreciated. I worked for this company for 5 years before resigning. I gave 5 years of my life and received nothing in return but repetitive mass e-mails and mandatory meetings revolving around how the employee can do more for the employer. No recognition is seen for employees in the form of empathy or even recognition for hard work, pay cuts, benefit cuts, mandatory over time or overall dedication regardless of company hardships. Employees are simply not on the priority list of "things management needs to take good care of". I am convinced employees are considered very expendable and treated as such by management.

review_title: Up until recently? I was proud. As of the last month? I wonder why I was so loyal, it obviously doesn't mean much.
pros: Team players, good support system,benefits, flexible schedule. Now? Can't think of a one.
cons: They lead you to believe that dedication & hard work means a lot, offer you a false sense of security. it's not about the employees OR the patients anymore, it's about the almighty $$. This will be their demise. OnceEGHCS is SOLD ( I dont care HOW they want to word it ), and they lose the President w/strong Christian values? oh yah, they're toast. It's sad, i've been an employee for almost a quarter century, and NO one could've told me they'd turn us out. Yet we wonder why people have no dedication/loyalty/ these days? I understand now. It's because it means nothing.

review_title: In the early years it was wonderfu. Lately it has become brainwashing and big business.
pros: The employees are wonderful. I was there 24 yrs until I became disabled. But times are a changing and I am glad I am no longer them. Not all change is bad but not all change is good either.
cons: Too much money spent on "programs" to improve our attitude and preformance. None of which is very effective in the long run.

pros: The reasons to work at EGH: good salary, excellent co-workers and staff. I cannot speak highly enough of my co-workers and the staff at EGH. They are caring and compassionate, they work together as a team.
cons: After the "merger" things have been very difficult. Management and Administration have an attitude of "be glad you have employment". Our insurance has gotten poorer (we're a hospital group that insures itself, how can it be so bad? But it is!) The latest benefit cut was short term disability. It is no longer automatically covered by the hospital, employees have to option for it and pay directly for STD. Again, we are a hospital, how can we not give staff STD?! There have been improvements: for a year or more overtime pay for the nursing staff was taken away and nurses were regularly being mandated to work double shifts. That has ended. But mgmt doesn't understand why there are still bad feelings from the staff. Also, our cleaning staff hire in wage was cut to minimum wage. Again, mgmt doesn't understand why turnover has increased greatly and the regular staff is being over worked to compensate for not having a big enough cleaning crew. These are just a couple of examples of things that have happened over the last 5 years.
